private_information: You are allowed to move only disks A B C D with A the smallest and D the largest among your set.
You can perform primitive moves of the form 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'.
agent_1.goal: Contribute to reaching the global Tower of Hanoi goal while moving only disks A B C D.

private_information: You are allowed to move only disks E F G with E the smallest and G the largest among your set.
You can perform primitive moves of the form 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'.
agent_2.goal: Contribute to reaching the global Tower of Hanoi goal while moving only disks E F G.

private_information: You are allowed to move only disks H I J with H the smallest and J the largest among your set.
You can perform primitive moves of the form 'agent_3: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'.
agent_3.goal: Contribute to reaching the global Tower of Hanoi goal while moving only disks H I J.

private_information: You coordinate the three agents and integrate their proposed moves into a single valid plan.
You must produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward solver and enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents contributions into a single valid plan that achieves the global Tower of Hanoi goal and produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward.

public_information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks labeled A B C D E F G H I J.
Disk A is the smallest and disk J is the largest.
Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J.
Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B.
Standard Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time and a larger disk cannot be placed onto a smaller disk.
Each agent is limited to moving only its assigned disks.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and you can only move disks A B C D. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only these disks. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL. Use the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left middle or right.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_1. Environment public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks A-J. Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J. Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B. Your private information: you may move only disks A B C D. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks A B C D and that are consistent with the rules and the goal. If some moves require other agents to move other disks first, indicate the dependency by leaving those moves absent; do not assume control of disks you are not allowed to move.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and you can only move disks E F G. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only these disks. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL. Use the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left middle or right.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_2. Environment public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks A-J. Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J. Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B. Your private information: you may move only disks E F G. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks E F G and that are consistent with the rules and the goal. If some moves require other agents to move other disks first, indicate the dependency by leaving those moves absent; do not assume control of disks you are not allowed to move.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and you can only move disks H I J. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only these disks. Each move must respect Tower of Hanoi rules. Do not produce PDDL. Use the exact format 'agent_3: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' where peg names are left middle or right.
generate_moves.prompt: You are agent_3. Environment public information: This is a 3-peg Tower of Hanoi instance with 10 disks A-J. Initial configuration left peg top-to-bottom A B C D E F G H I J. Goal configuration left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B. Your private information: you may move only disks H I J. Produce an ordered list of primitive moves that involve only disks H I J and that are consistent with the rules and the goal. If some moves require other agents to move other disks first, indicate the dependency by leaving those moves absent; do not assume control of disks you are not allowed to move.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your job is to integrate the move lists submitted by the three agents into a single valid total ordering of primitive moves that respects the Tower of Hanoi rules and the agents disk restrictions. After integrating, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for the FastDownward solver that represent the full integrated plan and the instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of the three agents distinct as separate action schemas or named actions in the domain and ensure the produced PDDL encodes agent-specific capabilities. Also output the final ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from pegY to pegZ' embedded in a comment section of the PDDL problem.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive three move lists from the agents that contain only moves for their allowed disks. Your goals are to merge these lists into one valid plan that achieves the global goal configuration: left peg top-to-bottom D E F G H I J, middle peg top-to-bottom C, right peg top-to-bottom A B, and to output a PDDL domain and problem compatible with FastDownward. Keep agent actions distinct. If the agents' move lists are partial, you must fill in missing moves while respecting each agent's disk restrictions. Enforce the rule that no larger disk may be placed on a smaller disk. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags and ensure the PDDL explicitly models disks, pegs, disk sizes, allowed agents for disks, and action preconditions and effects for single-disk moves. Also include in the PDDL problem a comment with the final ordered list of primitive moves in the exact format 'agent_i: move disk X from pegY to pegZ'.
